New Records: Rachin Ravindra and Devon Conway's unbeaten 273-run third-wicket stand is the highest partnership for two New Zealand batters in a Cricket World Cup encounter, surpassing the 168-run stand between Chris Harris and Lee Germon from 1996.
This was the first-ever occasion that all eleven batters in a side had reached double figures.
Key Match Events: New Zealand won by nine wickets, chasing down England's 282/9 in 36.2 overs.
Rachin Ravindra scored an unbeaten 123* and Devon Conway scored an unbeaten 152*.
Matt Henry took 3/48, Mitchell Santner took 2/37, and Glenn Phillips took 2/17 for New Zealand.
Jos Buttler scored 43 runs for England before being caught behind off Matt Henry.
Joe Root was dismissed by Glenn Phillips after misplaying a reverse sweep.
Jonny Bairstow hit a six off the second ball of the game.
Harry Brook hit 4, 4, 6 off three consecutive deliveries before being caught in the deep midwicket region.
Pre-Game Insights: Tom Latham, New Zealand's stand-in skipper, won the toss and decided to field.
New Zealand played without their regular captain Kane Williamson and pacer Tim Southee.
England's star all-rounder Ben Stokes was ruled out of the opening encounter.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was a rematch of the 2019 Cricket World Cup final, where England edged out New Zealand by the barest of margins to lift the trophy.
